revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Election | election_name = United States Senate elections, 1868 | country = United States | flag_year = 1867 | type = legislative | ongoing = no | previous_election = United States Senate elections, 1866 | previous_year = 1866 | next_election = United States Senate elections, 1870 | next_year = 1870 | seats_for_election = ? seats in the [[United States Senate]] | election_date = November 1868 | image1 = | party1 = Republican Party (United States) | last_election1 = 57 seats | seats1 = 62 | seat_change1 = +5 | popular_vote1 = | percentage1 = | swing1 = | image2 = | party2 = Democratic Party (United States) | last_election2 = 9 seats | seats2 = 12 | seat_change2 = +3 | popular_vote2 = | percentage2 = | swing2 = | title = Majority Party | before_election = Republican Party | after_election = Republican Party }}
The '''United States Senate election of 1868''' was an election which had the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] gain five seats in the [[United States Senate]], enlarging their already overwhelming majority.
As this election was prior to ratification of the [[Seventeenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|seventeenth amendment]], Senators were chosen by [[State legislature (United States)|State legislatures]].
==Results== Senate Party Division, [[41st United States Congress|41st Congress]] (1869â1871)
* Majority Party: Republican (62) * Minority Party: Democratic (12) * Other Parties: (0) * '''Total Seats: 74'''
